item.title: The October 2025 PS Plus Monthly Games are headlined by Alan Wake 2
item.content:encoded:
Tucked away in the State of Play stream was the confirmation of the PS Plus Monthly Games line up for October 2025, with Sony bringing a fantastic horror game to the table for the spookiest month of the year. Have you seen Alan lately?

What are the PS Plus October 2025 Monthly Games?

It’s quirky indie month on PS Plus and these games will be available from Tuesday, 7th October

  • Alan Wake 2  | PS5
  • Goat Simulator 3 | PS4, PS5
  • Cocoon  | PS4, PS5

Alan Wake 2 is a great headliner for this month’s PS Plus games. After a thirteen year wait, Remedy returned to the setting of one of their most beloved games, but took a distinctly more horror-tinged tone compared to the Xbox 360 original. Still, that totally worked for us. Nick gave it a glowing 10/10, and said:

“Just as it gives equal screen time to its two protagonists, Alan Wake 2 is a fine blend of equal parts narrative and survival horror. Both aspects are brought together in brilliant fashion to create a game that is going to mess with your head, scare the hell out of you and make you grin about it as you plunge forward once more, eager to see what’s next.”

How do you top that? Well, Cocoon is a simply sublime little puzzle adventure with worlds nested in worlds. It’s “a beautiful experience that marries a gorgeous aesthetic with increasingly complex puzzles that really push you to experiment with the game’s mechanics,” Steve said in our review. “Whilst it isn’t a long or excessively challenging game, I would urge you to absorb yourselves in its dimension-hopping delights.”

And then you can go all the way into the left field for Goat Simulator 3, the latest entry in the meme-able game series. The game launched back in 2022, with Pilgor the goat going on many an adventure which, through DLC, has included some dimension hopping of its own.

Can you still get the September 2025 PS Plus games?

Yes! You’ve got until Monday 6th Ocober September to claim your PS Plus games, which include:

  • Viewfinder  | PS5, PS4
  • Stardew Valley | PS4
  • Psychonauts 2  | PS4

Head here for the full skinny on that.

item.title: Gran Turismo 7 Spec 3 update drops in December
item.content:encoded:
Polyphony Digital isn’t done with Gran Turismo 7 yet, and series creator Kazunori Yamauchi appeared in the State of Play stream to announce that Gran Turismo 7 Spec 3 will arrive in December, as one of the game’s biggest updates yet.

The GT7 Spec 3 update will arrive in a few months with two new circuits, including Yas Marina.

There will also be eight new vehicles, a new circuit experience, data logger feature and more.

Stay tuned for more details on this as we get closer to the update’s release, but you can expect a lot of significant under the hood changes, with overhauled physics and more.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/24/gran-turismo-7-spec-3-update-drops-in-december/

item.title: Check out the trailer for Battlefield 6’s single player campaign
item.content:encoded:
EA have dropped an impressive trailer for the single player campaign of Battlefield 6, which is out this October.

“After the War Stories episode structure of Battlefield 1 and Battlefield V, Battlefield 6 is a return to a singular narrative, one that has you fighting battles across three continents. During this campaign, you’ll fight a tank battle under the shadows of the Pyramids, take to the streets of Brooklyn for intense gunfights, perform a HALO jump into enemy territory, and more in this modern military thriller,” explains EA’s Roman Campos-Oriola, Creative Director for the singe player game.

You will as the members of Dagger 13, an elite Marine Raiders unit. They are:

Haz Carter: a former high school quarterback who chose the rugged allure of the wilderness over being a sports star. During his time in the Marines, Haz was recognized for his blend of athletic prowess and survival skills, ultimately joining the Marine Raiders, rising to become an Assault expert and the leader of the squad.

Dylan Murphy: a warfighter who chose the frontlines over an officer’s career, Murphy’s courage and strategic thinking make him a vital member of Dagger as the team’s Engineer.

Simone “Gecko” Espina: Gecko learned to be a hunter on her grandfather’s farm and carried her expertise at tracking and taking on the elements into her military career. An adrenaline fanatic, Gecko became a Special Forces Operator. As the newest member of Dagger, she’s ready to prove herself as the squad’s Recon expert.

Cliff Lopez: Rejecting his parents’ wishes for him to go to med school, Lopez sought glory and adventure on the field of battle. Lopez wears his heart on his sleeve and as the squad’s Support is an essential member of the team.

Lucas Hemlock: A CIA Operator with a largely redacted past, all most people know about Hemlock is that he’s a true patriot to the end and is willing to do anything for his country.

Battlefield 6 will release on PS5, Xbox Series X|S and PC on 10th October.

Hands on Battlefield 6 – So, are we back?

Source: YouTube / PS Blog

item.title: Flight Simulator 2024 is coming to PS5, with PSVR2 support in development
item.content:encoded:
Surprising literally nobody, Flight Simulator 2024 has been announced for PlayStation 5, the latest Xbox exclusive to breach the previous platform divide. The game will arrive on PS5 on 8th December 2025, while PSVR 2 support is also in development for a later date.

Flight Simulator 2024, launched for Xbox and PC at the end of last year, an overhauled successor to the 2020 Flight Simulator, building on the same rendering of the real world that you can fly around, but building in a career mode, more missions, from Search and Rescue to tourism, agricultural crop dusting, and plenty more.

It’s a great simulator, but I think I’m most intrigued to see how PSVR 2 support looks on console, as the game is pretty heavy to run.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/24/flight-simulator-2024-is-coming-to-ps5-with-psvr2-support-in-development/

item.title: See the Saros gameplay and release date reveal – how does the Returnal sequel look?
item.content:encoded:
Housemarque and Sony have released a chunky five minutes of gameplay for the upcoming looper shooter roguelike Saros – the sequel to Returnal. The team have confirmed that Saros is coming to PS5 and PS5 Pro on 20th March 2026.

This latest tale takes players to the planet Carcosa, with an ominous eclipse and the end of the world sending Arjun Devraj (portrayed by Rahul Kohli) into a deadly time loop. He’s a Soltari Enforcer, looking for answers on a lost off-world colony which is repeatedly being destroyed by way and the death of the planet’s sun. He’s a bit chattier, it seems, as he has an AI companion, and hunt down Soltari datalog vaults to reveal more of the game’s story.

The gameplay structure will sound pretty familiar. It’s a roguelike third person shooter, very much in the vein of Returnal, with a permanent progression system wrapped around individual runs that reshape the world and give you new upgrade possibilities to find on the next attempt.

The action looks a bit faster than Returnal, though this may be my imagination, with more sprinting and dashing. Arjun comes with a Soltari Shield that can absorb and reflect projectives, using them to feel the Power Weapon, an Eclipse-driven weapon.

Second Chance is one of he permanent progression features, able to revive Arjun on his first death to immediately throw him back into the action of a particular run.

The video built up to the reveal of a big many-armed boss, with many more snippets of titanic gameplay to round things out.

Looking back on Returnal, our glowing 9/10 review of the PS5 launch window game said, “It feels immensely satisfying to be sat here in 2021, eons after playing Super Stardust HD on PS3, and see just how far Housemarque has come. Offering a visual bullet hell spectacle, a showcase for the DualSense controller and a rewarding sci-fi narrative woven around the roguelike loop, we can say with unflinching confidence that Returnal is the PS5’s best game to date.”
